title: Jhené Aiko
summary: Jhené Aiko Efuru Chilombo (/dʒəˈneɪ ˈaɪkoʊ/;[3] born March 16, 1988) is an American singer who embarked on her music career contributing vocals and appearing in several music videos for R&B group B2K. At the time, she was known as B2K member Lil' Fizz's "cousin", though she is not actually related to him.[4][5] It was used as a marketing tool, suggested by Sony and Epic Records to promote Aiko through the group and cultivate her own following.[6][7] In 2003, Aiko was set to release her debut album, My Name Is Jhené, through her labels Sony, The Ultimate Group and Epic; however, the album was never released, with Aiko eventually asking to be released from the label in order to continue her education.[8]
